name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: When the Turtles are first shown in the film, what are they doing?
questions.explanation:
Training.

	The Turtles were training and dancing when they first popped on screen. After a montage of them showing off their weapons and their acrobatic skills, Raph threw one of his sais against a light and smashed it. He was upset because the Turtles continued to hide in the sewer and train rather than take their skills to the street and put them to use.

questions.text: April brought the Turtles all gifts before she prepared to go on vacation early in the movie. Mikey's gift was a pair of skateboarding shorts.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Mikey got a Hawaiian themed lampshade, which he immediately used as a hat.Leo got a book about swords, Donnie a broken radio to repair and Raph got a vintage hat.

questions.text: The plot revolved around time travel. Where was it that the Turtles traveled back in time to visit?
questions.explanation:
Feudal Japan.

	The Turtles' form of Ninjitsu is based on a form from ancient Japan. When April bought what she called an old "egg timer" at a flea market, it kicked off a series of events that caused her to travel back in time. After that, the Turtles also used the device to go back in time to rescue her.

questions.text: When travelling back in time, the Turtles emerged in the middle of a battle. Which of them was riding backwards on his horse?
questions.explanation:
Mikey.

	Mikey wound up riding his horse backwards, and also was the one with the time travel device. He couldn't control his horse, and wound up traveling through the woods where he was attacked and knocked unconscious.

questions.text: What did Walker, a British trader, keep trying to sell to the native people where the Turtles ended up?
questions.explanation:
Guns.

	Walker was the main villain in the movie. He was a trader who decided to attack and kill the Japanese if they couldn't be convinced to buy the guns that he was selling. The Turtles arrived just in time to stop him from razing the village before heading back to modern day New York.

questions.text: Casey Jones turned on a TV to keep his time-traveling guests occupied. What was on that kept them captivated?
questions.explanation:
A hockey game.

	Casey was watching over the five men from ancient Japan that travelled to the future as the Turtles and April went to the past. They were getting impatient and demanding to go home. Instead of giving them the device, he used a remote control to turn on a hockey game. The guys were all entranced by the TV and calmed down. Casey remarked to Splinter about how they weren't even in the playoffs yet. After the game, Casey taught them how to play hockey.

questions.text: Raph befriended a child while living in the past. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Yoshi.

	Yoshi was a small boy who had a big temper. Raph, who had the biggest temper of the Turtles, taught him how to calm and control his temper. Just before the Turtles fought Walker and the other invaders, Raph and Yoshi had a moment where they exchanged gifts.

questions.text: While fighting a small army of soldiers, the Turtles used several sports terms. What sport did they refer to on each occasion?
questions.explanation:
Baseball.

	Donnie, while using his Bo Staff to attack three soldiers at once, yelled "home run". Raph later on in the same fight declared a triple play as he knocked out three more soldiers. There were several other baseball references during the fight as well.

questions.text: Did the Turtles ever eat pizza in the movie?
questions.explanation:
No.

	This was the first film in the franchise to not show the Turtles eating even a single slice of pizza. Mickey did try to make one while in Feudal Japan, but none of the Turtles was ever seen actually eating it. It was also the first movie in the franchise to not use the word "Cowabunga".

questions.text: Which Turtle was nearly left in the past?
questions.explanation:
Mikey.

	At First Mikey and Raph had decided to stay in the past. Once they were talked out of it, Mikey had some last second goodbyes to make. He missed out on grabbing the time travel device and didn't return with his brothers and April. However a few seconds later, Mikey replaced the last of the Japanese Samurai Soldiers who had taken their place in the future.
